etymology.description: Phonetic: 𠂈 (a knife) + Semantic: 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") -> denoting rarity/preciousness -> 丁 (a nail) added as phonetic at bottom as black dot -> corruption to 十, 匕, 目, and 丌 -> final form 真
etymology.interpretation: The character 真(真) (zhēn, "true") emerged as a combination of 𠂈, a phonetic element related to knives, and semantic 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") to indicate value or rarity. The complex evolution involved the addition and transformation of 丁 and other elements, eventually settling in the form 真 commonly used today to mean "true" or "real."

examples.chinese: 这件衣服真漂亮(這件衣服真漂亮)。
examples.english: This piece of clothing is really beautiful.

examples.chinese: 他说的话真可信(他說的話真可信)，她的笑容真温暖(她的笑容真溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō de huà zhēn kěxìn, tā de xiàoróng zhēn wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: What he said is truly credible, and her smile is really warm.
